content:
@StPaulTim In case you're interested in a new (experimental) Pelerine feature, have a look here: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/pelerine/issues/5 Any feedback is welcome. I'm not sure yet if adding custom css rules via UI is a useful feature. (Yes, I'm aware of the css_injector module.)

Allow custom css via user interface 路 Issue #5 路 backdrop-contrib/pelerine
Just a thought: maybe someone's interested in having the ability to set custom css rules in a textarea (no subtheme required, no need to touch any files on server). If anyone's interested, ...

I am interested in this. Personally, I am unlikely to use this feature on a site I'm building, but I know that casual users are looking for this option.

Occasionally, I'm asked to help fix a minor problem on a Wordpress site (for a friend without money) and the ability to add CSS through the UI is a huge relief to fix a small problem without having to gain access to the server.

Also, for https://www.simplo.site - I want users to be able to make small css changes to their own sites without accessing the server.
@BWPanda (Peter) - Just curious if you have looked at this: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4512

I can't see any reason for lots of checkboxes. I think this can be done easily without a UI/options on the settings page. Or if we want to give users some control, we could give them a simple choice of "Give me all updates until _______ version." One select list of options, pick the version that you want. I don't see that list of options getting very long (and there are good options without even providing that).
